contents: He takes a big bite and grins at me. I frown. The sugar is supposed to be salt! My dad continues to chew away. (23) <u>Pondering this wonder, I pour some milk on my own cereal, which I pre-sugared from the sugar in the cupboard, and take a bite.</u> Ugh! Salt! I cough and spit. My dad laughs at me and points. “Gotcha!” he says. “I knew you’d do the salt-in-the-sugar-bowl prank!”
